results.title: Paris
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Practical guide to Europe”.
A practical guide for anyone intending to travel to Paris. Highlights the major cultural attractions, historical districts and shopping precincts. Provides advice on public transport options and locating suitable accommodation. Offers tips on visiting galleries and museums during free or quiet periods. Suggests where to eat and what you should expect to pay. Includes the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, Disneyland, Fountainbleau and Versailles. Presented by John Guerrasio.

results.title: Pariki and the flying foxes (A)
results.creator_credit: Robin James and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
Belzah Lowah narrates this story of the Dreamtime, based on a retelling by Charles P. Mountford. The story is of Pariki, a young boy, one of the first people, who lived on an island. Although he had many animal friends he was lonely, and so, when one day he found himself in an unexplored part of the island, he ventured deep into the forest in spite of the warnings of the rock python. Here he met the evil bat spirit, whose bats caught him and carried him up into the heavens where they became stars and Pariki became the biggest star of all, with the bat spirit becoming the man in the moon.

results.title: Parents who work
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Thomas has a sore throat but is sent to school due to his parents’ commitments at the office. Should Dad or Mum have stayed at home? This program looks at parenting and dual responsibility, the importance of forward planning employers’ attitudes to women with families, how and why employers should help and how to negotiate with a partner.

results.title: Parents are people too
results.brief_description: Discusses adolescent feelings of resentment against authority and emphasises the role of the parent, the teacher, and the adolescent himself in resolving differences. Shows how family discussions can replace arguments and help establish good family relations.

results.title: Parenting: stress and the child
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Looks at some potentially stressful family situations for the child, such as the arrival of a baby, entry into a new school, and puberty. Indicates that, although stress is inevitable in children’s lives, once the causes are realised by parents, it can be utilised as a stepping stone towards emotional growth and family unity.
